intro: Rustia sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
